{{DEFAULTSORT:Fareela, Fathimath}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actresses]] [[Category:Maldivian film actresses]] [[Category:1984 births]]

{{short description|Maldivian film actress|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Infobox person | name = Fathimath Fareela | image = | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1984|10|24}} | birth_place = [[Kulhudhuffushi|HDh. Kulhudhuffushi]], Maldives | alma_mater = | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 2006–present | spouse = {{unbulleted list||{{marriage|[[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]|reason=div.}}}} | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Fathimath Fareela''' (24 October 1984) is a Maldivian film actress.
==Career== Fareela made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |url-status=dead |archive-date=5 March 2012 |access-date=26 November 2018 }}</ref> The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the grumbling wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Supporting Actress]].<ref name=GFA5won/>
In 2009, Fareela starred as the valiant and fearless girl who unintentionally falls in love with her sister's love interest in ''[[Loaiybahtakaa]]'' which was written and directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]].<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa">{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Best 10 Actors |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The romantic drama, co-starring Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Mohamed Faisal (actor)|Mohamed Faisal]], tells the story of unrequited love, and proved to be a commercial success.<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa"/>
This was followed by a horror film, ''[[Mendhamuge Evaguthu]]'' (2010) co-written and co-directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] alongside [[Amjad Ibrahim]].<ref name=AmjeyAward/> It follows a group of ten friends watching a horror film which is being influenced by a narration in it.<ref name=AmjeyAward>{{cite news |url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |title=National Award of Recognition 2006 - Amajd Ibrahim |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190213170003/http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |url-status=dead |archive-date=13 February 2019 |access-date=13 February 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The last release of 2010, featured Fareela in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010), opposite Shafeeu and [[Sheela Najeeb]].<ref name=Heyonuvaane>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name=Heyonuvaane/> She played the role of Dr. Rizna Zareer, who meets her lover after six years settled with a marriage.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview/> The film received majorly negative reviews from critics though her performance was commended.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Twenty two housefull shows of the film were screened at cinema, declaring it a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneDVD>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Fareela began 2011 with Amjad Ibrahim's suspense thriller film ''Hafaraaiy'' alongside [[Ali Shameel]], [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]], [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and [[Amira Ismail]], which was a critical and commercial failure.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Based on a real incidence, the film narrates a story of a cannibal woman who is addicted to [[Human cannibalism|eats human flesh]], how she victimised the inhabitants with her face covered in a veil.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> The film received criticism for its "fragile" plot, "unnecessary" characters though its makeup was appreciated.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Ahmed Naif from ''Sun'' wrote: "neither scientifically nor psychologically, it has been proven in the film how a chicken addict turns to be a cannibal. The film slides from a suspense thriller to a comedy for its inclusion of inconceivable details". He was displeased with Fareela's role citing it "small and unnecessary".<ref name=Hafaraaiy>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5963 |title=Review of Amjay's Hafaraaiy |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=14 March 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181001034052/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/LKMR |url-status=dead |archive-date=1 October 2018 |access-date=1 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She next appeared in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s family drama ''[[E Bappa]]'' (2011), featuring an ensemble cast including Hassan Manik, [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mohamed Manik]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Lufshan Shakeeb]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]].<ref name=EBappa>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |title=Reasons why E Bappa Flopped |language=Divehi|work=Youtube |author=MNBC |date=4 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003052804/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 October 2018 |access-date=3 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> A film about [[fatherhood]] and how he has been treated by his family, received negative reviews for its "typical stereotype style" and was a box office failure.<ref name=EBappa/>
In 2013, Fareela featured in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed horror film ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' which serves as a prequel to ''Fathis Handhuvaru'' (1997) starring [[Reeko Moosa Manik]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]] in lead roles. It was based on a story by Ibrahim Waheed, ''Jinaa: Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun'' (2009), which itself is a prequel to the story ''Fathishandhuvaru'' (1996) written by himself which was later adapted to a film by same name in 1997.<ref name=awaited>{{cite news|url=https://www.addulive.com/2219 |title="Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun": Most awaited release of the year|language=Divehi|work=Addu Live |last=Faisal |first=Ibrahim |date=5 January 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919033325/https://www.addulive.com/2219 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was marketed as being the first 3D release for a Maldivian film and the first release derived from [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]].<ref name=postponed>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/fathis_handhuvaruge_feshun_movie/126501 |title=Premier of "Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun" postponed again |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=7 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919034425/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/RonRE |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She played the role of Nihaa, the love interest of a ghost, Jinaa—played by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] that seeks revenge from humans for killing its wife.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://vnews.mv/4094 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" is a disappointment |language=Divehi |work=Vnews |last=Zaina |first=Fathimath |date=18 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919051113/http://vnews.mv/4094 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon release the film received generally negative reviews from critics.<ref name=FHF3Dreview/> Ahmed Nadheem from ''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' wrote: "Everyone in the cast gave a forgettable performance. Fareela [still] needs to handle major scenes more efficiently such as in the climax where the entire ongoing things were revealed, her expressions and acting doesnt work there".<ref name=FHF3Dreview>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/film_review/137114 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" review |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=17 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919045055/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/0NRVW |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Despite the negative reviews, at the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was nominated in the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress award]] category for her performance in the film.<ref name=GFA7nom>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10378 |title=Nominations for 7th Gaumee Film Awards Announced |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330160950/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28015 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref>
In 2014, she played a supporting character in Mohamed Nimal-directed family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'' alongside [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Mohamed Jumayyil]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]].They were introduced by a common friend, Mohamed Hashim, a Maldivian diplomat based in UAE. <ref name=aniyaa>{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> The story of the film revolves around a boy who has been deprived of love from his parents.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> Due to several technical errors and struggle caused during the screening of the film, it failed to garner enough hype ultimately doing average to poor business at boxoffice.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/director_ahmed_nimal/152778 |title=Olympus ge Aniyaa in Nimal ge Hiyy Kathilaifi |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=9 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919135623/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/B3BKY |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Next she starred opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aishath Rishmy]] in Seezan's directorial venture, psychological thriller ''[[Insaana]]'', playing the friend of Hana who is murdered by her husband.<ref name=insaana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |title=Seezan's new film is "Insaanaa" |newspaper=[[Haveeru Daily|Haveeru]] |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |language=Divehi |date=16 August 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140822052911/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |archive-date=22 August 2014 |access-date=1 November 2018 }}</ref> It revolves around a murder and how the murderer tries to evade from the crime.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |title=Ticlet sales kick-off for "Insaanaa" |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=1 September 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903153426/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |archive-date=3 September 2014 }}</ref> Made on a budget of MVR 220,000, the film was inspired by [[Ryan Connolly (presenter)|Ryan Connolly]]'s [[Short Film|short]] [[psychological horror]] film ''[[Tell (2012 film)|Tell]]'' (2012) which is loosely based on the [[Edgar Allan Poe]] short story "[[The Tell-Tale Heart]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |title=Is "Insaanaa" copied? |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=21 August 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140823134402/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |archive-date=23 August 2014 }}</ref> Upon release, the film received widespread critical acclaim. Hassan Naail from ''Vaguthu'' called it "one of the best Maldivian release till date" and was satisfied with the performance of whole cast.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://vaguthu.mv/?p=170979 |title=Insaana Review |language=Divehi |work=Vaguthu |last=Nail |first=Ismail |date=22 September 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181103073849/https://vaguthu.mv/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 November 2018 |access-date=1 November 2018}} [https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6JXaw Alt URL]</ref> At the 2015 [[South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation]] Film Festival, ''Insaana'' was bestowed with Bronze Medal as Best Film, competing with seventeen regional films.<ref name=SAARC>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/ali_seezan/172126 |title="Insaanaa" awarded bronze medal at SAARC Film Festival |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |language=Divehi|date=31 May 2015 |access-date=1 November 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181101160350/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/yldyn |archive-date=1 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.island.lk/index.php?page_cat=article-details&page=article-details&code_title=146036 |title=SAARC Film Festival to be screened in Colombo from June 1–6 |work=[[The Island (Sri Lanka)]] |date=29 May 2016 |accessdate=1 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2016, she appeared in Ibrahim Wisan's debut direction ''[[Vee Beyvafa]]'' which was shot in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |title="Vee Beyvafa" to premier in 13 islands along with Male' |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140232/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film received a negative response from critics where Ahmed Adhushan of ''Mihaaru'' concluded his review calling the film "a step backward" in the progress of cinema.<ref name=veebeyvafa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |title="Vee Beyvafa": A step backward |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140908/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2019, first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released which featured Fareela in the segment directed by [[Ali Shifau]], titled ''Foshi''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.vn/wip/sn50N |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The project was shot in 2013 and digitally released six years later due to several delays in post-production.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.vn/wip/hXfji |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>

{{DEFAULTSORT:Fareela, Fathimath}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actresses]] [[Category:Maldivian film actresses]] [[Category:1984 births]]

{{short description|Maldivian film actress|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Infobox person | name = Fathimath Fareela | image = | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1984|10|24}} | birth_place = [[Kulhudhuffushi|HDh. Kulhudhuffushi]], Maldives | alma_mater = | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 2006–present | spouse = {{unbulleted list||{{marriage|[[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]|reason=div.}}}} | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Fathimath Fareela''' (24 October 1984) is a Maldivian film actress.
==Career== Fareela made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |url-status=dead |archive-date=5 March 2012 |access-date=26 November 2018 }}</ref> The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the grumbling wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Supporting Actress]].<ref name=GFA5won/>
In 2009, Fareela starred as the valiant and fearless girl who unintentionally falls in love with her sister's love interest in ''[[Loaiybahtakaa]]'' which was written and directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]].<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa">{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Best 10 Actors |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The romantic drama, co-starring Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Mohamed Faisal (actor)|Mohamed Faisal]], tells the story of unrequited love, and proved to be a commercial success.<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa"/>
This was followed by a horror film, ''[[Mendhamuge Evaguthu]]'' (2010) co-written and co-directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] alongside [[Amjad Ibrahim]].<ref name=AmjeyAward/> It follows a group of ten friends watching a horror film which is being influenced by a narration in it.<ref name=AmjeyAward>{{cite news |url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |title=National Award of Recognition 2006 - Amajd Ibrahim |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190213170003/http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |url-status=dead |archive-date=13 February 2019 |access-date=13 February 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The last release of 2010, featured Fareela in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010), opposite Shafeeu and [[Sheela Najeeb]].<ref name=Heyonuvaane>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name=Heyonuvaane/> She played the role of Dr. Rizna Zareer, who meets her lover after six years settled with a marriage.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview/> The film received majorly negative reviews from critics though her performance was commended.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Twenty two housefull shows of the film were screened at cinema, declaring it a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneDVD>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Fareela began 2011 with Amjad Ibrahim's suspense thriller film ''Hafaraaiy'' alongside [[Ali Shameel]], [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]], [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and [[Amira Ismail]], which was a critical and commercial failure.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Based on a real incidence, the film narrates a story of a cannibal woman who is addicted to [[Human cannibalism|eats human flesh]], how she victimised the inhabitants with her face covered in a veil.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> The film received criticism for its "fragile" plot, "unnecessary" characters though its makeup was appreciated.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Ahmed Naif from ''Sun'' wrote: "neither scientifically nor psychologically, it has been proven in the film how a chicken addict turns to be a cannibal. The film slides from a suspense thriller to a comedy for its inclusion of inconceivable details". He was displeased with Fareela's role citing it "small and unnecessary".<ref name=Hafaraaiy>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5963 |title=Review of Amjay's Hafaraaiy |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=14 March 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181001034052/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/LKMR |url-status=dead |archive-date=1 October 2018 |access-date=1 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She next appeared in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s family drama ''[[E Bappa]]'' (2011), featuring an ensemble cast including Hassan Manik, [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mohamed Manik]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Lufshan Shakeeb]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]].<ref name=EBappa>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |title=Reasons why E Bappa Flopped |language=Divehi|work=Youtube |author=MNBC |date=4 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003052804/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 October 2018 |access-date=3 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> A film about [[fatherhood]] and how he has been treated by his family, received negative reviews for its "typical stereotype style" and was a box office failure.<ref name=EBappa/>
In 2013, Fareela featured in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed horror film ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' which serves as a prequel to ''Fathis Handhuvaru'' (1997) starring [[Reeko Moosa Manik]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]] in lead roles. It was based on a story by Ibrahim Waheed, ''Jinaa: Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun'' (2009), which itself is a prequel to the story ''Fathishandhuvaru'' (1996) written by himself which was later adapted to a film by same name in 1997.<ref name=awaited>{{cite news|url=https://www.addulive.com/2219 |title="Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun": Most awaited release of the year|language=Divehi|work=Addu Live |last=Faisal |first=Ibrahim |date=5 January 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919033325/https://www.addulive.com/2219 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was marketed as being the first 3D release for a Maldivian film and the first release derived from [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]].<ref name=postponed>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/fathis_handhuvaruge_feshun_movie/126501 |title=Premier of "Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun" postponed again |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=7 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919034425/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/RonRE |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She played the role of Nihaa, the love interest of a ghost, Jinaa—played by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] that seeks revenge from humans for killing its wife.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://vnews.mv/4094 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" is a disappointment |language=Divehi |work=Vnews |last=Zaina |first=Fathimath |date=18 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919051113/http://vnews.mv/4094 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon release the film received generally negative reviews from critics.<ref name=FHF3Dreview/> Ahmed Nadheem from ''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' wrote: "Everyone in the cast gave a forgettable performance. Fareela [still] needs to handle major scenes more efficiently such as in the climax where the entire ongoing things were revealed, her expressions and acting doesnt work there".<ref name=FHF3Dreview>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/film_review/137114 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" review |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=17 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919045055/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/0NRVW |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Despite the negative reviews, at the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was nominated in the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress award]] category for her performance in the film.<ref name=GFA7nom>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10378 |title=Nominations for 7th Gaumee Film Awards Announced |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330160950/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28015 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref>
In 2014, she played a supporting character in Mohamed Nimal-directed family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'' alongside [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Mohamed Jumayyil]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]].They were introduced by a common friend, Mohamed Hashim, a Maldivian diplomat based in UAE. <ref name=aniyaa>{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> The story of the film revolves around a boy who has been deprived of love from his parents.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |accessdate=9 June 2016}}</ref> Due to several technical errors and struggle caused during the screening of the film, it failed to garner enough hype ultimately doing average to poor business at boxoffice.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/director_ahmed_nimal/152778 |title=Olympus ge Aniyaa in Nimal ge Hiyy Kathilaifi |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=9 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919135623/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/B3BKY |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Next she starred opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aishath Rishmy]] in Seezan's directorial venture, psychological thriller ''[[Insaana]]'', playing the friend of Hana who is murdered by her husband.<ref name=insaana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |title=Seezan's new film is "Insaanaa" |newspaper=[[Haveeru Daily|Haveeru]] |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |language=Divehi |date=16 August 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140822052911/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |archive-date=22 August 2014 |access-date=1 November 2018 }}</ref> It revolves around a murder and how the murderer tries to evade from the crime.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |title=Ticlet sales kick-off for "Insaanaa" |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=1 September 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903153426/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |archive-date=3 September 2014 }}</ref> Made on a budget of MVR 220,000, the film was inspired by [[Ryan Connolly (presenter)|Ryan Connolly]]'s [[Short Film|short]] [[psychological horror]] film ''[[Tell (2012 film)|Tell]]'' (2012) which is loosely based on the [[Edgar Allan Poe]] short story "[[The Tell-Tale Heart]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |title=Is "Insaanaa" copied? |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=21 August 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140823134402/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |archive-date=23 August 2014 }}</ref> Upon release, the film received widespread critical acclaim. Hassan Naail from ''Vaguthu'' called it "one of the best Maldivian release till date" and was satisfied with the performance of whole cast.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://vaguthu.mv/?p=170979 |title=Insaana Review |language=Divehi |work=Vaguthu |last=Nail |first=Ismail |date=22 September 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181103073849/https://vaguthu.mv/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 November 2018 |access-date=1 November 2018}} [https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6JXaw Alt URL]</ref> At the 2015 [[South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation]] Film Festival, ''Insaana'' was bestowed with Bronze Medal as Best Film, competing with seventeen regional films.<ref name=SAARC>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/ali_seezan/172126 |title="Insaanaa" awarded bronze medal at SAARC Film Festival |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |language=Divehi|date=31 May 2015 |access-date=1 November 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181101160350/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/yldyn |archive-date=1 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.island.lk/index.php?page_cat=article-details&page=article-details&code_title=146036 |title=SAARC Film Festival to be screened in Colombo from June 1–6 |work=[[The Island (Sri Lanka)]] |date=29 May 2016 |accessdate=1 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2016, she appeared in Ibrahim Wisan's debut direction ''[[Vee Beyvafa]]'' which was shot in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |title="Vee Beyvafa" to premier in 13 islands along with Male' |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140232/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film received a negative response from critics where Ahmed Adhushan of ''Mihaaru'' concluded his review calling the film "a step backward" in the progress of cinema.<ref name=veebeyvafa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |title="Vee Beyvafa": A step backward |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140908/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2019, first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released which featured Fareela in the segment directed by [[Ali Shifau]], titled ''Foshi''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.vn/wip/sn50N |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The project was shot in 2013 and digitally released six years later due to several delays in post-production.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.vn/wip/hXfji |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |accessdate=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Filmography== ===Feature film=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2005 !scope="row"| ''[[Hureemey Inthizaarugaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Bunedheyshey Mithura" | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HureemeyInthizaarugaa/> |- | 2006 !scope="row"| ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | Azu | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress]] | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=GFA5won/> |- | 2009 !scope="row"| ''[[Loaiybahtakaa]]'' | Shabee | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa"/> |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Mendhamuge Evaguthu]]'' | Mahira | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=AmjeyAward/> |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' | Rizna Zareer | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview/> |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''Hafaraaiy'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=Hafaraaiy/> |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[E Bappa]]'' | Mazeena | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=EBappa/> |- | 2013 !scope="row"| ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' | Niha | Nominated—[[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=FHF3Dreview/><ref name=GFA7nom/> |- | 2014 !scope="row"| ''[[Aniyaa]]'' | Zilma | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=aniyaa/> |- | 2014 !scope="row"| ''[[Insaana]]'' | Inaa | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=insaana/> |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Vee Beyvafa]]'' | Nisha | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=veebeyvafa/> |- |}
===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2012–2013 !scope="row"| ''[[Adhives Eloaibah Gadharu Kuran]]'' | Fazeela | Main role | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=UmurahSalaan>{{cite news |url=https://avas.mv/46185 |title=Who would excel in the acting field in "Huvaa" |language=Divehi |work=Avas |last=Ifraz |first=Ali |date=14 March 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190609164537/https://avas.mv/46185 |url-status=live |archive-date=9 June 2019 |access-date=22 December 2018 }}</ref> |- | 2019 !scope="row"| ''[[Hatharu Halha]]'' | Sama | In the segment ''Foshi'' | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HHInt/> |- |}
===Short film=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2007 !scope="row"| ''[[Edhonveli Thundi|Edhonveli Thundi 1]]'' | Spirit | Voice-over | style="text-align: center;"|<ref name=child>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/5512 |title=Nahula searching for child to play an important role |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=5 September 2016 |archiveurl=http://archive.vn/wip/TjO6a |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |accessdate=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- | 2008 !scope="row"| ''[[Edhonveli Thundi|Edhonveli Thundi 2]]'' | Spirit | Special appearance | style="text-align: center;"|<ref name=child/> |- | 2014 !scope="row"| ''Kashfu'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- |}
==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | rowspan="3"| 2008 ! scope="row" rowspan="3"| [[5th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]] | ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA5won>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |title=Winners of 5th Gaumee Film Awards |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |date=13 April 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181221053708/http://webcache.dhivehi.mv/haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |url-status=dead |archive-date=21 December 2018 |access-date=21 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Choreography|Best Choreography]] | "Anaashey" – ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA5won/> |- | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Makeup|Best Makeup]] | ''[[Hukuru Vileyrey]]'' <small>(shared with Hassan Adam)</small> | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA5won/> |- | rowspan="2"| 2014 ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | [[3rd Maldives Film Awards]] | [[Maldives Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress]] | ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=MFA3nom>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/153617 |title=Maldives Film Awards Nominations out |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150405165421/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/153617 |url-status=dead |archive-date=5 April 2015 |access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref> |- | Best Choreography | ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=MFA3nom/> |- | 2016 ! revision.comment: archive link repair, may include: archive.* -> archive.today, http->https for ghostarchive.org and archive.org, and fixing refs for IABot [[phab:T291704]]
revision.text:
{{short description|Maldivian film actress|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Infobox person | name = Fathimath Fareela | image = | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1984|10|24}} | birth_place = [[Kulhudhuffushi|HDh. Kulhudhuffushi]], Maldives | alma_mater = | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 2006–present | spouse = {{unbulleted list||{{marriage|[[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]|reason=div.}}}} | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Fathimath Fareela''' (24 October 1984) is a Maldivian film actress.
==Career== Fareela made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |url-status=dead |archive-date=5 March 2012 |access-date=26 November 2018 }}</ref> The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the grumbling wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Supporting Actress]].<ref name=GFA5won/>
In 2009, Fareela starred as the valiant and fearless girl who unintentionally falls in love with her sister's love interest in ''[[Loaiybahtakaa]]'' which was written and directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]].<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa">{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Best 10 Actors |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The romantic drama, co-starring Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Mohamed Faisal (actor)|Mohamed Faisal]], tells the story of unrequited love, and proved to be a commercial success.<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa"/>
This was followed by a horror film, ''[[Mendhamuge Evaguthu]]'' (2010) co-written and co-directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] alongside [[Amjad Ibrahim]].<ref name=AmjeyAward/> It follows a group of ten friends watching a horror film which is being influenced by a narration in it.<ref name=AmjeyAward>{{cite news |url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |title=National Award of Recognition 2006 - Amajd Ibrahim |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190213170003/http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |url-status=dead |archive-date=13 February 2019 |access-date=13 February 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The last release of 2010, featured Fareela in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010), opposite Shafeeu and [[Sheela Najeeb]].<ref name=Heyonuvaane>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name=Heyonuvaane/> She played the role of Dr. Rizna Zareer, who meets her lover after six years settled with a marriage.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview/> The film received majorly negative reviews from critics though her performance was commended.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Twenty two housefull shows of the film were screened at cinema, declaring it a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneDVD>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Fareela began 2011 with Amjad Ibrahim's suspense thriller film ''Hafaraaiy'' alongside [[Ali Shameel]], [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]], [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and [[Amira Ismail]], which was a critical and commercial failure.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Based on a real incidence, the film narrates a story of a cannibal woman who is addicted to [[Human cannibalism|eats human flesh]], how she victimised the inhabitants with her face covered in a veil.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> The film received criticism for its "fragile" plot, "unnecessary" characters though its makeup was appreciated.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Ahmed Naif from ''Sun'' wrote: "neither scientifically nor psychologically, it has been proven in the film how a chicken addict turns to be a cannibal. The film slides from a suspense thriller to a comedy for its inclusion of inconceivable details". He was displeased with Fareela's role citing it "small and unnecessary".<ref name=Hafaraaiy>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5963 |title=Review of Amjay's Hafaraaiy |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=14 March 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181001034052/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/LKMR |url-status=dead |archive-date=1 October 2018 |access-date=1 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She next appeared in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s family drama ''[[E Bappa]]'' (2011), featuring an ensemble cast including Hassan Manik, [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mohamed Manik]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Lufshan Shakeeb]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]].<ref name=EBappa>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |title=Reasons why E Bappa Flopped |language=Divehi|work=Youtube |author=MNBC |date=4 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003052804/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 October 2018 |access-date=3 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> A film about [[fatherhood]] and how he has been treated by his family, received negative reviews for its "typical stereotype style" and was a box office failure.<ref name=EBappa/>
In 2013, Fareela featured in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed horror film ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' which serves as a prequel to ''Fathis Handhuvaru'' (1997) starring [[Reeko Moosa Manik]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]] in lead roles. It was based on a story by Ibrahim Waheed, ''Jinaa: Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun'' (2009), which itself is a prequel to the story ''Fathishandhuvaru'' (1996) written by himself which was later adapted to a film by same name in 1997.<ref name=awaited>{{cite news|url=https://www.addulive.com/2219 |title="Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun": Most awaited release of the year|language=Divehi|work=Addu Live |last=Faisal |first=Ibrahim |date=5 January 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919033325/https://www.addulive.com/2219 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was marketed as being the first 3D release for a Maldivian film and the first release derived from [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]].<ref name=postponed>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/fathis_handhuvaruge_feshun_movie/126501 |title=Premier of "Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun" postponed again |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=7 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919034425/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/RonRE |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She played the role of Nihaa, the love interest of a ghost, Jinaa—played by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] that seeks revenge from humans for killing its wife.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://vnews.mv/4094 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" is a disappointment |language=Divehi |work=Vnews |last=Zaina |first=Fathimath |date=18 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919051113/http://vnews.mv/4094 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon release the film received generally negative reviews from critics.<ref name=FHF3Dreview/> Ahmed Nadheem from ''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' wrote: "Everyone in the cast gave a forgettable performance. Fareela [still] needs to handle major scenes more efficiently such as in the climax where the entire ongoing things were revealed, her expressions and acting doesnt work there".<ref name=FHF3Dreview>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/film_review/137114 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" review |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=17 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919045055/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/0NRVW |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Despite the negative reviews, at the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was nominated in the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress award]] category for her performance in the film.<ref name=GFA7nom>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10378 |title=Nominations for 7th Gaumee Film Awards Announced |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330160950/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28015 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref>
In 2014, she played a supporting character in Mohamed Nimal-directed family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'' alongside [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Mohamed Jumayyil]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]].They were introduced by a common friend, Mohamed Hashim, a Maldivian diplomat based in UAE. <ref name=aniyaa>{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |access-date=9 June 2016}}</ref> The story of the film revolves around a boy who has been deprived of love from his parents.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |access-date=9 June 2016}}</ref> Due to several technical errors and struggle caused during the screening of the film, it failed to garner enough hype ultimately doing average to poor business at boxoffice.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/director_ahmed_nimal/152778 |title=Olympus ge Aniyaa in Nimal ge Hiyy Kathilaifi |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=9 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919135623/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/B3BKY |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Next she starred opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aishath Rishmy]] in Seezan's directorial venture, psychological thriller ''[[Insaana]]'', playing the friend of Hana who is murdered by her husband.<ref name=insaana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |title=Seezan's new film is "Insaanaa" |newspaper=[[Haveeru Daily|Haveeru]] |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |language=Divehi |date=16 August 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140822052911/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |archive-date=22 August 2014 |access-date=1 November 2018 }}</ref> It revolves around a murder and how the murderer tries to evade from the crime.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |title=Ticlet sales kick-off for "Insaanaa" |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=1 September 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903153426/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |archive-date=3 September 2014 }}</ref> Made on a budget of MVR 220,000, the film was inspired by [[Ryan Connolly (presenter)|Ryan Connolly]]'s [[Short Film|short]] [[psychological horror]] film ''[[Tell (2012 film)|Tell]]'' (2012) which is loosely based on the [[Edgar Allan Poe]] short story "[[The Tell-Tale Heart]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |title=Is "Insaanaa" copied? |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=21 August 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140823134402/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |archive-date=23 August 2014 }}</ref> Upon release, the film received widespread critical acclaim. Hassan Naail from ''Vaguthu'' called it "one of the best Maldivian release till date" and was satisfied with the performance of whole cast.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://vaguthu.mv/?p=170979 |title=Insaana Review |language=Divehi |work=Vaguthu |last=Nail |first=Ismail |date=22 September 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181103073849/https://vaguthu.mv/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 November 2018 |access-date=1 November 2018}} [https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6JXaw Alt URL]</ref> At the 2015 [[South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation]] Film Festival, ''Insaana'' was bestowed with Bronze Medal as Best Film, competing with seventeen regional films.<ref name=SAARC>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/ali_seezan/172126 |title="Insaanaa" awarded bronze medal at SAARC Film Festival |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |language=Divehi|date=31 May 2015 |access-date=1 November 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181101160350/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/yldyn |archive-date=1 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.island.lk/index.php?page_cat=article-details&page=article-details&code_title=146036 |title=SAARC Film Festival to be screened in Colombo from June 1–6 |work=[[The Island (Sri Lanka)]] |date=29 May 2016 |access-date=1 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2016, she appeared in Ibrahim Wisan's debut direction ''[[Vee Beyvafa]]'' which was shot in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |title="Vee Beyvafa" to premier in 13 islands along with Male' |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140232/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film received a negative response from critics where Ahmed Adhushan of ''Mihaaru'' concluded his review calling the film "a step backward" in the progress of cinema.<ref name=veebeyvafa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |title="Vee Beyvafa": A step backward |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140908/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2019, first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released which featured Fareela in the segment directed by [[Ali Shifau]], titled ''Foshi''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/wip/sn50N |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |access-date=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The project was shot in 2013 and digitally released six years later due to several delays in post-production.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/wip/hXfji |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |access-date=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>

{{DEFAULTSORT:Fareela, Fathimath}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian actresses]] [[Category:Maldivian film actresses]] [[Category:1984 births]] [[Category:People from Kulhudhuffushi]]

{{short description|Maldivian film actress|bot=PearBOT 5}} {{Infobox person | name = Fathimath Fareela | image = | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=y|1984|10|24}} | birth_place = [[Kulhudhuffushi|HDh. Kulhudhuffushi]], Maldives | alma_mater = | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 2006–present | spouse = {{unbulleted list||{{marriage|[[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]|reason=div.}}}} | children = | works = | awards = }} '''Fathimath Fareela''' (24 October 1984) is a Maldivian film actress.
==Career== Fareela made her film debut in [[Ahmed Nimal]]'s romantic film ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' (2006), starred alongside [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mariyam Afeefa]] and [[Fauziyya Hassan]] which was a critical and commercial success, considered to be the most successful Maldivian release of the year.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |title=Top 10 Actresses in Malives |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=23 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120305014312/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/117464 |url-status=dead |archive-date=5 March 2012 |access-date=26 November 2018 }}</ref> The film follows a conflicted husband struggling to convey equal affection towards his two spouses. Her performance as the grumbling wife received critical appreciation, winning her a [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Gaumee Film Award as the Best Supporting Actress]].<ref name=GFA5won/>
In 2009, Fareela starred as the valiant and fearless girl who unintentionally falls in love with her sister's love interest in ''[[Loaiybahtakaa]]'' which was written and directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]].<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa">{{cite news|url=https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |title=Best 10 Actors |work=Dho? |language=Divehi |last=Maaha |first=Aishath |date=21 February 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190106182050/https://dho.mv/baiscope/31481 |url-status=live |archive-date=6 January 2019 |access-date=4 January 2019 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The romantic drama, co-starring Shafeeu, [[Sheela Najeeb]] and [[Mohamed Faisal (actor)|Mohamed Faisal]], tells the story of unrequited love, and proved to be a commercial success.<ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa"/>
This was followed by a horror film, ''[[Mendhamuge Evaguthu]]'' (2010) co-written and co-directed by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] alongside [[Amjad Ibrahim]].<ref name=AmjeyAward/> It follows a group of ten friends watching a horror film which is being influenced by a narration in it.<ref name=AmjeyAward>{{cite news |url=http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |title=National Award of Recognition 2006 - Amajd Ibrahim |work=Presidency Maldives |language=Divehi |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190213170003/http://inaamu.presidencymaldives.gov.mv/Index.aspx?lid=177&wid=322 |url-status=dead |archive-date=13 February 2019 |access-date=13 February 2019 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> The last release of 2010, featured Fareela in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s drama film ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' (2010), opposite Shafeeu and [[Sheela Najeeb]].<ref name=Heyonuvaane>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4101 |title="Heyonuvaane" shouldn't be missed |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=27 December 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929062532/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/wkep |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The story revolves around a male who is victimised of domestic abuse.<ref name=Heyonuvaane/> She played the role of Dr. Rizna Zareer, who meets her lover after six years settled with a marriage.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview/> The film received majorly negative reviews from critics though her performance was commended.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/4544 |title="Heyonuvaane": Year's most boring film|language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naaif |first=Ahmed |date=17 January 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929063548/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/dKRr |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=26 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Twenty two housefull shows of the film were screened at cinema, declaring it a Mega-Hit and second highest grossing Maldivian release of the year.<ref name=HeyonuvaaneDVD>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/12004 |title="Heyonuvaane" DVD releasing on coming Tuesday |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Raaniya |first=Mariyam |date=24 October 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180929064751/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/2BRk |url-status=dead |archive-date=29 September 2018 |access-date=28 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Fareela began 2011 with Amjad Ibrahim's suspense thriller film ''Hafaraaiy'' alongside [[Ali Shameel]], [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]], [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] and [[Amira Ismail]], which was a critical and commercial failure.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Based on a real incidence, the film narrates a story of a cannibal woman who is addicted to [[Human cannibalism|eats human flesh]], how she victimised the inhabitants with her face covered in a veil.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> The film received criticism for its "fragile" plot, "unnecessary" characters though its makeup was appreciated.<ref name=Hafaraaiy/> Ahmed Naif from ''Sun'' wrote: "neither scientifically nor psychologically, it has been proven in the film how a chicken addict turns to be a cannibal. The film slides from a suspense thriller to a comedy for its inclusion of inconceivable details". He was displeased with Fareela's role citing it "small and unnecessary".<ref name=Hafaraaiy>{{cite news|url=https://sun.mv/5963 |title=Review of Amjay's Hafaraaiy |language=Divehi|work=Sun |last=Naif |first=Ahmed |date=14 March 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181001034052/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/LKMR |url-status=dead |archive-date=1 October 2018 |access-date=1 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She next appeared in [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]]'s family drama ''[[E Bappa]]'' (2011), featuring an ensemble cast including Hassan Manik, [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]], [[Mohamed Manik]], [[Sheela Najeeb]], [[Lufshan Shakeeb]], [[Amira Ismail]] and [[Mariyam Shakeela (actress)|Mariyam Shakeela]].<ref name=EBappa>{{cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |title=Reasons why E Bappa Flopped |language=Divehi|work=Youtube |author=MNBC |date=4 February 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181003052804/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbW6QQCYaSE |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 October 2018 |access-date=3 October 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> A film about [[fatherhood]] and how he has been treated by his family, received negative reviews for its "typical stereotype style" and was a box office failure.<ref name=EBappa/>
In 2013, Fareela featured in [[Ali Shifau]]-directed horror film ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' which serves as a prequel to ''Fathis Handhuvaru'' (1997) starring [[Reeko Moosa Manik]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]] in lead roles. It was based on a story by Ibrahim Waheed, ''Jinaa: Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun'' (2009), which itself is a prequel to the story ''Fathishandhuvaru'' (1996) written by himself which was later adapted to a film by same name in 1997.<ref name=awaited>{{cite news|url=https://www.addulive.com/2219 |title="Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun": Most awaited release of the year|language=Divehi|work=Addu Live |last=Faisal |first=Ibrahim |date=5 January 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919033325/https://www.addulive.com/2219 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film was marketed as being the first 3D release for a Maldivian film and the first release derived from [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]].<ref name=postponed>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/fathis_handhuvaruge_feshun_movie/126501 |title=Premier of "Fathishandhuvaruge Feshun" postponed again |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=7 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919034425/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/RonRE |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> She played the role of Nihaa, the love interest of a ghost, Jinaa—played by [[Yoosuf Shafeeu]] that seeks revenge from humans for killing its wife.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://vnews.mv/4094 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" is a disappointment |language=Divehi |work=Vnews |last=Zaina |first=Fathimath |date=18 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919051113/http://vnews.mv/4094 |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Upon release the film received generally negative reviews from critics.<ref name=FHF3Dreview/> Ahmed Nadheem from ''[[Haveeru Daily]]'' wrote: "Everyone in the cast gave a forgettable performance. Fareela [still] needs to handle major scenes more efficiently such as in the climax where the entire ongoing things were revealed, her expressions and acting doesnt work there".<ref name=FHF3Dreview>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/film_review/137114 |title="Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun" review |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed|date=17 April 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919045055/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/0NRVW |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Despite the negative reviews, at the [[7th Gaumee Film Awards]] she was nominated in the [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress award]] category for her performance in the film.<ref name=GFA7nom>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/10378 |title=Nominations for 7th Gaumee Film Awards Announced |language=Divehi |work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=16 December 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330160950/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/28015 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref>
In 2014, she played a supporting character in Mohamed Nimal-directed family drama ''[[Aniyaa]]'' alongside [[Ismail Rasheed]] and [[Mohamed Jumayyil]] and [[Niuma Mohamed]].They were introduced by a common friend, Mohamed Hashim, a Maldivian diplomat based in UAE. <ref name=aniyaa>{{cite news|url=http://vnews.mv/18164 |title=First release of the year "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Vnews |author=Ali, Safoora |date=29 March 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160609172231/http://vnews.mv/18164 |archivedate=9 June 2016 |access-date=9 June 2016}}</ref> The story of the film revolves around a boy who has been deprived of love from his parents.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://addulive.com/05113572013 |title=Jumayyyil is being launched to the industry with "Aniyaa" |language=Divehi|publisher=Addu Live |author=Faisal, Ibrahim |date=4 May 2013 |access-date=9 June 2016}}</ref> Due to several technical errors and struggle caused during the screening of the film, it failed to garner enough hype ultimately doing average to poor business at boxoffice.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/director_ahmed_nimal/152778 |title=Olympus ge Aniyaa in Nimal ge Hiyy Kathilaifi |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=9 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180919135623/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/B3BKY |url-status=dead |archive-date=19 September 2018 |access-date=19 September 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> Next she starred opposite [[Ali Seezan]] and [[Aishath Rishmy]] in Seezan's directorial venture, psychological thriller ''[[Insaana]]'', playing the friend of Hana who is murdered by her husband.<ref name=insaana>{{cite news |url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv:80/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |title=Seezan's new film is "Insaanaa" |newspaper=[[Haveeru Daily|Haveeru]] |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |language=Divehi |date=16 August 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140822052911/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159532 |archive-date=22 August 2014 |access-date=1 November 2018 }}</ref> It revolves around a murder and how the murderer tries to evade from the crime.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |title=Ticlet sales kick-off for "Insaanaa" |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=1 September 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903153426/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/160212 |archive-date=3 September 2014 }}</ref> Made on a budget of MVR 220,000, the film was inspired by [[Ryan Connolly (presenter)|Ryan Connolly]]'s [[Short Film|short]] [[psychological horror]] film ''[[Tell (2012 film)|Tell]]'' (2012) which is loosely based on the [[Edgar Allan Poe]] short story "[[The Tell-Tale Heart]]".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |title=Is "Insaanaa" copied? |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |author=Nadheem, Ahmed |language=Divehi|date=21 August 2014 |access-date=8 October 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140823134402/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/159764 |archive-date=23 August 2014 }}</ref> Upon release, the film received widespread critical acclaim. Hassan Naail from ''Vaguthu'' called it "one of the best Maldivian release till date" and was satisfied with the performance of whole cast.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://vaguthu.mv/?p=170979 |title=Insaana Review |language=Divehi |work=Vaguthu |last=Nail |first=Ismail |date=22 September 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181103073849/https://vaguthu.mv/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=3 November 2018 |access-date=1 November 2018}} [https://archive.mv/dv/articles/6JXaw Alt URL]</ref> At the 2015 [[South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation]] Film Festival, ''Insaana'' was bestowed with Bronze Medal as Best Film, competing with seventeen regional films.<ref name=SAARC>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/ali_seezan/172126 |title="Insaanaa" awarded bronze medal at SAARC Film Festival |newspaper=Haveeru Daily |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |language=Divehi|date=31 May 2015 |access-date=1 November 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181101160350/https://archive.mv/dv/articles/yldyn |archive-date=1 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.island.lk/index.php?page_cat=article-details&page=article-details&code_title=146036 |title=SAARC Film Festival to be screened in Colombo from June 1–6 |work=[[The Island (Sri Lanka)]] |date=29 May 2016 |access-date=1 November 2018}}</ref>
In 2016, she appeared in Ibrahim Wisan's debut direction ''[[Vee Beyvafa]]'' which was shot in 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |title="Vee Beyvafa" to premier in 13 islands along with Male' |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140232/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9672 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The film received a negative response from critics where Ahmed Adhushan of ''Mihaaru'' concluded his review calling the film "a step backward" in the progress of cinema.<ref name=veebeyvafa>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |title="Vee Beyvafa": A step backward |language=Divehi|work=Mihaaru |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=30 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180330140908/https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/9748 |url-status=live |archive-date=30 March 2018 |access-date=30 March 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2019, first Maldivian [[Anthology film|anthology]] film was released which featured Fareela in the segment directed by [[Ali Shifau]], titled ''Foshi''.<ref name=HHInt>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/entertainment/62002 |title=After a six years' gap, Hatharu Halha to release in Baiskoafu |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=29 September 2020 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/sn50N |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |access-date=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> The project was shot in 2013 and digitally released six years later due to several delays in post-production.<ref name=HHcont>{{cite news|url=https://avas.mv/14072 |title=Ravee on Hot seat in Hatharu Halha project |work=Avas |language=Divehi |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=4 March 2016 |archiveurl=https://archive.today/hXfji |url-status=live |archivedate=10 September 2020 |access-date=10 September 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Filmography== ===Feature film=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2005 !scope="row"| ''[[Hureemey Inthizaarugaa]]'' | Herself | Special appearance in the song "Bunedheyshey Mithura" | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HureemeyInthizaarugaa/> |- | 2006 !scope="row"| ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | Azu | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress]] | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=GFA5won/> |- | 2009 !scope="row"| ''[[Loaiybahtakaa]]'' | Shabee | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name="HureemeyInthizaarugaa"/> |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Mendhamuge Evaguthu]]'' | Mahira | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=AmjeyAward/> |- | 2010 !scope="row"| ''[[Heyonuvaane]]'' | Rizna Zareer | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HeyonuvaaneReview/> |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''Hafaraaiy'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=Hafaraaiy/> |- | 2011 !scope="row"| ''[[E Bappa]]'' | Mazeena | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=EBappa/> |- | 2013 !scope="row"| ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' | Niha | Nominated—[[Gaumee Film Award for Best Actress]] | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=FHF3Dreview/><ref name=GFA7nom/> |- | 2014 !scope="row"| ''[[Aniyaa]]'' | Zilma | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=aniyaa/> |- | 2014 !scope="row"| ''[[Insaana]]'' | Inaa | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=insaana/> |- | 2016 !scope="row"| ''[[Vee Beyvafa]]'' | Nisha | | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=veebeyvafa/> |- |}
===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2012–2013 !scope="row"| ''[[Adhives Eloaibah Gadharu Kuran]]'' | Fazeela | Main role | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=UmurahSalaan>{{cite news |url=https://avas.mv/46185 |title=Who would excel in the acting field in "Huvaa" |language=Divehi |work=Avas |last=Ifraz |first=Ali |date=14 March 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190609164537/https://avas.mv/46185 |url-status=live |archive-date=9 June 2019 |access-date=22 December 2018 }}</ref> |- | 2019 !scope="row"| ''[[Hatharu Halha]]'' | Sama | In the segment ''Foshi'' | style="text-align: center;"| <ref name=HHInt/> |- |}
===Short film=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- style="background:#ccc; text-align:center;" !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Title !scope="col"| Role !scope="col"| Notes ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | {{Tooltip|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | 2007 !scope="row"| ''[[Edhonveli Thundi|Edhonveli Thundi 1]]'' | Spirit | Voice-over | style="text-align: center;"|<ref name=child>{{cite news|url=https://mihaaru.com/index.php/entertainment/5512 |title=Nahula searching for child to play an important role |work=Mihaaru |language=Divehi |last=Adhushan |first=Ahmed |date=5 September 2016 |archiveurl=http://archive.today/TjO6a |url-status=live |archivedate=20 August 2020 |access-date=20 August 2020 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- | 2008 !scope="row"| ''[[Edhonveli Thundi|Edhonveli Thundi 2]]'' | Spirit | Special appearance | style="text-align: center;"|<ref name=child/> |- | 2014 !scope="row"| ''Kashfu'' | {{n/a}} | | style="text-align: center;"| |- |}
==Accolades== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- !scope="col"| Year !scope="col"| Award !scope="col"| Category !scope="col"| Nominated work !scope="col"| Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable"| {{Abbr|Ref(s)|Reference(s)}} |- | rowspan="3"| 2008 ! scope="row" rowspan="3"| [[5th Gaumee Film Awards]] | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]] | ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA5won>{{cite news|url=http://haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |title=Winners of 5th Gaumee Film Awards |language=Divehi|work=Haveeru |last=Ahmed |first=Fazeena |date=13 April 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181221053708/http://webcache.dhivehi.mv/haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/news/60767 |url-status=dead |archive-date=21 December 2018 |access-date=21 December 2018 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> |- | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Choreography|Best Choreography]] | "Anaashey" – ''[[Vaaloabi Engeynama]]'' | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA5won/> |- | [[Gaumee Film Award for Best Makeup|Best Makeup]] | ''[[Hukuru Vileyrey]]'' <small>(shared with Hassan Adam)</small> | {{won}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=GFA5won/> |- | rowspan="2"| 2014 ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | [[3rd Maldives Film Awards]] | [[Maldives Film Award for Best Actress|Best Actress]] | ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=MFA3nom>{{cite news|url=http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/153617 |title=Maldives Film Awards Nominations out |language=Divehi |work=Haveeru |last=Nadheem |first=Ahmed |date=29 April 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150405165421/http://www.haveeru.com.mv/dhivehi/entertainment/153617 |url-status=dead |archive-date=5 April 2015 |access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref> |- | Best Choreography | ''[[Fathis Handhuvaruge Feshun 3D]]'' | {{nom}} |style="text-align:center;"|<ref name=MFA3nom/> |- | 2016 !
